employee_external_id.notes: Direct mapping - Stackone uses employee_id in request body for time off creation

absence_type_external_id.notes: Direct mapping - Stackone uses 'type' field for absence type in time off requests

status.notes: Direct mapping - Status field maps directly to Stackone time off request status

start_date.notes: Direct mapping - Start date field maps directly to Stackone time off request start_date (string format)

end_date.notes: Direct mapping - End date field maps directly to Stackone time off request end_date (string format)

start_half_day.notes: Direct mapping - Boolean field indicating if time off starts halfway through the day

end_half_day.notes: Direct mapping - Boolean field indicating if time off ends halfway through the day

amount.notes: Conversion mapping - Stackone uses 'duration' field instead of 'amount'. May need calculation from start_date/end_date or direct value mapping

unit.notes: Logical mapping - Stackone uses single 'duration' field (string) instead of separate amount/unit. Unit information may be embedded in duration format or calculated from date range

employee_note.notes: Logical mapping - Stackone uses 'passthrough' object for additional data. Employee note would need to be embedded in passthrough object structure

processing_context: Stackone Unified HRIS API - Time Off Management. Primary endpoint: POST /unified/hris/employees/{id}/time_off using HrisCreateTimeOffRequestDto schema
